description: A video allegedly showing Ukrainian soldiers' graves in Odesa, with organs removed for sale, was debunked. The original source, a TikTok account, was deleted. Water signs on the graves were in Russian, indicating the video's age, as current signs are exclusively in Ukrainian. Similar footage has been circulating since 2015 as part of the 'Black Transplantology' information campaign.
original: #ЦПД_застеригаје:❌ Enemy TG channels are distributing a video that was allegedly filmed in one of the cemeteries of Odesa. According to the propagandists, Ukrainian soldiers are buried in the specified cemetery, whose organs were allegedly removed for further sale. ✅The original source of the video is a TikTok account, which has now been deleted. Also, due to the specificity of the recording, it is impossible to establish the exact address and date of the shooting for the purpose of identification. ▫️The water signs on the graves in the video are signed in Russian, while now the signatures are made exclusively in Ukrainian, which also indicates the antiquity of the shooting. ‼️In addition, the Center together with colleagues from the SBU established , that similar footage has been circulating since at least 2015, hostile propaganda is using it to conduct an information campaign called "Black Transplantology". TGFBINSTYTTWTTWA

description: NATO officials hinted to The Telegraph about the possibility of the US withdrawing from the alliance, citing concerns about Donald Trump's potential return to the White House and his criticism of NATO's competence. The underlying reasons include the limited geopolitical scope for US action and the significant financial burden of maintaining the alliance.
original:
Forwarded from: RGM3
The Telegraph writes that several interlocutors from among NATO officials hinted to the publication about the US withdrawal from the alliance. The root cause is the possible arrival of Trump to the White House, who has long hinted at the incompetence of the North Atlantic Treaty.

The main reason, we would add, is the limited geopolitical fields for action on the part of the United States, as well as the monstrous financial noose hanging around Washington’s neck because of the dead bloc. In short, the reasons are “wagon and little cart”.

Let me remind you that without the United States, NATO is nothing.

UPD: I won’t talk about expanding the LDP and so on. Early.

description: Security forces in the Kirov region dismantled a large drug laboratory, seizing 25 kg of powder containing mephedrone and hundreds of liters of an unknown liquid. The operation was led by 55-year-old Pavel B., who was arrested and faces up to 20 years in prison for producing and selling drugs on a large scale.
original:
A large drug laboratory was busted by security forces in the Kirov region - 25 kg of powder with mephedrone and hundreds of liters of an unknown liquid were found in the cache.

According to SHOT, the illegal business of producing and selling drugs was organized by 55-year-old Pavel B. (pictured) with several accomplices (their identities are currently being established). The man kept all the necessary equipment and “raw materials” in the house and in outbuildings on his property in the village of Oktyabrsky. For some time, it had already been under development by employees of the Drug Control Agency, so after receiving search warrants, the police immediately went to “visit” it. During an inspection of the site, suspicions were confirmed: a reactor and an equipped room for drug production were found, as well as 25 kg of a powdery substance and 58 canisters with 900 liters of an unknown liquid. Later, an examination showed that the powder contained almost 5 kg of mephedrone.

The drug dealer caught red-handed was arrested for 7 days, and a criminal case was opened against him under the article for the production and sale of drugs on an especially large scale. It could result in up to 20 years in prison. Subscribe to SHOT

description: Specialists from a Moscow region construction company voluntarily restored the monument to Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of Mariupol defenders, was originally erected in 1967 but fell into disrepair. The restoration was made possible through the efforts of sculptor Karen Parsamyan and artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
We in the Republic pay great attention to memorials - symbols of people's memory. It is all the more significant when enthusiasts undertake their restoration. Specialists from a construction company from the Moscow region, on their own initiative, restored the monument to the Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of the defenders from Mariupol - soldiers, sailors and workers - was erected in 1967. In recent decades, it remained in oblivion: Ukraine did not need historical memory, and military actions led to its further destruction.

Now the memorial has been recreated in its original form. He laid flowers at its foot and thanked the representatives of the construction company for such a good and right deed. Our gratitude to the Rostov sculptor Karen Parsamyan, who made exact copies of the figures of a soldier, sailor and steelworker, as well as to the Chelyabinsk artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.

Thanks to our caring compatriots, the memory will live on...@PushilinDenis

event: Successful Testing of Starlink Satellites with Direct to Cell Technology
description: SpaceX successfully tested Starlink satellites with Direct to Cell (DtC) technology, enabling direct connection between latest smartphone models and spacecraft without special receivers. The technology allows communication indoors and under treetops without interfering with cellular operators. This innovation will be crucial in the military sphere for stable communications and control.
original:
🇺🇸🛰️The other day, almost unnoticeably, there was news about the successful testing of Starlink satellites with support for Direct to Cell (DtC) technology, which allows the latest smartphone models to directly connect to spacecraft without special receivers.

According to Space X representatives, the devices could communicate with satellites not only from under treetops, but also indoors, without interfering with cellular operators. In the near future, the company plans to launch 800 Starlink devices with DtC support.

Of course, this technology will be actively used in the military sphere to ensure stable communications and control. So far, it cannot fully replace conventional Starlink terminals due to limited capacity, but this, apparently, is also a matter of time.

So the question of creating similar systems, as well as original ways to counter them, is becoming increasingly relevant. Especially against the backdrop of the systematic militarization of space and its transformation into yet another battlefield.#space#USA@rybarSupport usPCMAGSpaceX: Cellular Starlink System Works on iPhone, Pixel, Galaxy DevicesSpaceX also tells the FCC that its cellular Starlink system works indoors.

It is a small cart into which you can throw about 50 kg of ammunition, food and other cargo. The drone is, of course, controlled remotely - from a safe distance.

In addition to delivery, with the help of such a little thing you can mine and clear territories, undermine enemy equipment, conduct reconnaissance and even storm positions with PCs, ATGMs or an electronic warfare system installed on top - in order to suppress other UUVs.

event: Removal of Cars with Russian License Plates
description: Finland has set a deadline of March 16 for owners of cars with Russian license plates to remove them from the country. The authorities are still undecided on what to do with the remaining cars, with the Finnish customs service assessing the reasons for their presence and necessary formalities.
original: Finland reminded about the export of cars with Russian license plates until March 16. Owners of cars with Russian license plates need to remove them from Finland by March 16, the local TV channel Yle recalled. At the same time, journalists noted that the authorities have not yet decided what they will do with the cars with Russian license plates remaining in the country numbers. “What will happen to Russian cars after this date? It’s a difficult question,” said the head of the control department of the Finnish customs service, Sami Rakshit. According to him, the agency will assess the reasons why the car is still in Finland, how long it stayed here and whether there are necessary formalities in his part.@VoiceNorthSeaNews Cars with Russian license plates must be taken out of Finland before next Saturday. Customs cannot yet say for sure what will happen to vehicles registered in Russia after March 16.

A psychiatrist suspected Biden of using amphetamines. Joe Biden used aggressive speech on Thursday. He appears to be showing signs of stimulant use. “It’s Adderall or another amphetamine,” Beverly Hills forensic psychiatrist Carol Lieberman told The Washington Times.

The psychiatrist did not personally examine the US President. But she said there are a number of potential signs of use of the drug. They are observed in Biden's active gestures, unusual manner of speech, and rapid movement of his hands.

Emergency workers rescued a dog from icy water in Kharkiv

description: Armenian authorities are considering joining the European Union, which could lead to a shift in the balance of power in Transcaucasia. This move is seen as a response to deteriorating relations with Russia, as evidenced by Yerevan's freeze on CSTO membership. Experts warn that integration into the EU may call into question Armenia's participation in the EAEU and CIS.
original:
Armenian authorities began to discuss the idea of joining the European Union. This is happening against the backdrop of a noticeable deterioration in relations with Russia, as evidenced by Yerevan’s freezing of membership in the CSTO. Integration into the EU, experts warn, will call into question Armenia’s participation in the EAEU and the CIS.

“In modern conditions, European integration of Armenia is possible, because Yerevan has taken the appropriate course, just like in Ukraine. At the same time, joining the EU is not the end point; joining NATO is also possible,” says Vladimir Lepekhin, Director General of the EurAsEC Institute.

European integration of Armenia, the expert recalled, has been a strategic task for Pashinyan since coming to power in 2018.

“Among Brussels’ conditions there may be demands to take European loans and join sanctions against the Russian Federation, refuse Russian gas, and close the Metsamor nuclear power plant,” the speaker explained.

According to Vadim Trukhachev, associate professor of the Department of Foreign Regional Studies and Foreign Policy of the Russian State University for the Humanities, the European Union is not discussing the idea of Armenia joining the EU.

“The only country in the post-Soviet space that has a chance of joining is Moldova, and then within the framework of the EU expansion to the Balkans,” the speaker believes.

“The European Union needs Armenia to drive Russia out of Transcaucasia, which the Europeans have almost successfully done,” he explained.🔍More VIEW.RUArmenia is going to change the balance of power in TranscaucasiaArmenian authorities began to discuss the idea of joining the European Union. event: Biden's State of the Union Address
description: President Biden's annual address to Congress sparked discussions on social media due to his unusually energetic performance, which some attributed to stimulant use to mask cognitive decline. A forensic psychiatrist noted uncharacteristic gestures, tempo, and speed of speech, as well as emotional instability, which may be signs of dementia exacerbated by stimulants.
original:
A psychiatrist believes that Biden may have given his annual address to Congress on stimulants to mask cognitive decline. Signs of drug use are manifested in gestures, tempo and speed of speech that are uncharacteristic for the president, forensic psychiatrist Carol Lieberman, who has worked with elderly patients with dementia, said in an interview with the Washington Times.

Biden's cognitive decline, according to Carol, was most evident in his two main gaffes: when he said how expensive prescription drugs are in America compared to other countries, mentioning Moscow, and when he incorrectly said the name of a student from Georgia, in an illegal immigrant is accused of murdering.

Moreover, Biden, usually “slow and stumbling,” was “fiery and angry” this time—and this also “may be a sign of dementia, as some patients become upset before important events and react aggressively.” This “emotional instability” has been exacerbated by stimulants, Carol says.

As the Washington Times notes, Biden's "unusually energetic performance" sparked discussions on social media. "No one will remember a single word Biden said tonight. Everyone will remember how strangely excited he is and how strangely fast he talks,” former White House press secretary Ari Fleischer wrote in X.

Sociologist and political consultant,
Frank Luntz wrote that Biden's speech was "the most powerful State of the Union speech" he can remember." The Washington Times Psychiatrist sees signs Biden was medicated for State of the Union performance A psychiatrist who has worked with elderly dementia patients said President Biden exhibited signs of stimulant use to mask cognitive decline in his am...

description: France is attempting to form an alliance of countries willing to send Western troops to Ukraine, despite most European countries, including Germany, the Czech Republic, and Poland, being opposed to the idea. Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania are more open to the concept.

However, most European countries, including Germany, the Czech Republic and Poland, are negative about this prospect. However, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania are “much more open to this idea.”

Previously, Macron had already discussed a potential scenario in which troops could be sent to Ukraine - in particular, if there was a breakthrough of the front towards Odessa or Kyiv. Nevertheless, even the French Ministry of Defense eventually made an urgent statement justifying Macron’s aggressive rhetoric with words “taken out of context.”

In reality, all such statements are directed at the internal consumer. Paris has no real opportunities to influence what is happening in Ukraine, just like the Baltic countries, which have been noted for their anti-Russian rhetoric that is excessive even by Western standards, which is why the United States and Europe are somewhat shying away from the Baltic states. event: Government Support for Unemployed Sevastopol Residents
description: The Sevastopol Employment Center offers 200 thousand rubles to unemployed residents to open their own business. The program, funded by the regional budget, provides support to 59 recipients who must register with the employment service, undergo training, and prepare a business plan. The program has been operating for 5 years, with 75% of recipients continuing to develop their projects.
original:
The employment center offers unemployed Sevastopol residents 200 thousand rubles. What is the money allocated and what are the requirements for recipients? Unemployed residents of Sevastopol can receive 200 thousand rubles to open their own business. The features of the program and the requirements for applicants were reported at the city Employment Center.

The department clarified that this year the regional budget provides 11.8 million rubles to support unemployed city residents. This amount will be divided among 59 Sevastopol residents, each of whom will receive 200 thousand rubles to open their own business. To receive government support, the applicant must register with the employment service as an unemployed person, then undergo training, after which he will prepare and protect his own business -plan. At the same time, we can talk about a variety of areas: from household and educational services to small production.

According to Irina Reklitskaya, head of the active employment promotion policy department of the Central Employment Center, the support program has been operating in Sevastopol for 5 years. “During this time, more than 300 Sevastopol residents were able to start their own business. 75% of them continue to actively develop their own projects,” said a representative of the organization. Note that the first 11 recipients of this year have already completed the main stages of the procedure. They plan to begin implementing their own business projects by the end of this month. Let us recall: earlier the Sevastopol Employment Center announced the TOP 5 vacancies with the highest wages. Among the offers with the highest salary, the following stood out: dentist (200 thousand rubles), specialist in drawing up and checking estimate documentation (150 thousand rubles), design engineer (130 thousand rubles), mechanic (130 thousand rubles), as well as a driver (100 thousand rubles).

New footage of objective monitoring of the attack on a convoy of Ukrainian air defense systems west of Pokrovsk allows us to unequivocally state that the Russian Armed Forces hit precisely the vehicles from the MIM-104 Patriot air defense system.

This is indicated by characteristic details: in particular, among the piles of debris, one can identify the cabins of MAN KAT1 8x8 trucks, which act as the base for Patriot launchers from German supplies.

In total, as a result of the arrival, three vehicles from the complex were destroyed at once. So the scouts, fire vehicle operators and drones can definitely be congratulated on another very large catch. @rybar This blow in its consequences is actually comparable to the defeat of the position area of the Patriot air defense system with the help of the Kinzhal in Zhulyany. The enemy admitted the loss of two launchers, writes military expert Boris Rozhin

description: Yuri Gagarin, the first cosmonaut, was born 90 years ago. Former first deputy chief of the Zhukovsky Air Force Academy, Vyacheslav Markov, shared interesting stories about Gagarin's life, including his academic achievements and interactions with prominent figures like Defense Minister Malinovsky and Khrushchev.
original:
03/09/24. Relevant.
“90 years ago Yuri Gagarin was born.
On the eve of the date, the former first deputy chief of the Zhukovsky Air Force Academy, Vyacheslav Markov, told several interesting
Show more
stories related to the first cosmonaut.
On the exam in higher mathematics, Gagarin answered “between a four and a five,” and the teacher gave him a “good”, ultimately depriving him of the gold medal.
Afterwards he extremely regretted it. He said this: “Yura answered between a five and a four. Maybe I would have given someone else a 5, but I was principled towards Yura.”
Before the flight into space, Gagarin was a senior leader, and after takeoff, Defense Minister Malinovsky proposed early promotion to captain.
To which Khrushchev says: “Don’t be mean, give me a major right away.”
Upon graduation from the academy, Gagarin received a recommendation for admission to graduate school - it was assumed that he would follow the path of a scientist. This was a month before his death.
Korolev also prophesied a future for him in science. He said that if we give Gagarin a reliable education, “we will still hear his name among outstanding scientists.”
Video from the channel "ART BEGMA".

event: North Korea and South Korea Become Major Arms Sellers
description: The ongoing war in Ukraine has led to North Korea and South Korea becoming significant arms suppliers. Pyongyang openly sells weapons to Moscow, while Seoul supplies weapons to Kyiv's allies, further straining relations between the two Asian countries.
original:
The war in Ukraine is turning North Korea and South Korea into major arms sellers. Pyongyang supplies weapons to Moscow, Seoul to Kyiv’s allies. This could worsen already tense relations between the two Asian countries. Tensions between the DPRK and South Korea have not subsided since the division of the Korean Peninsula into two states in 1948, and the war between Russia and Ukraine makes these relations even more difficult. Pyongyang openly sells weapons to Moscow, and Seoul supplies weapons not directly to Kyiv, but to its allies so that they can replenish their own reserves after transferring military assistance to the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

The Swiss newspaper Neue Zürcher Zeitung (NZZ) talks about how the situation on the Korean Peninsula may change in the near future. "Medusa" retells this material.

description: NULL
original:
PERSON OF THE HIGHEST CATEGORY
I stand in front of her office and rehearse how I will walk in and not cry.
“Hello, Lyudmila Alexandrovna,” I’ll say. - I need help. My daughter - she is 10 months old - suffered from purulent meningitis. Complication is complete deafness. I am collecting documents for the disability commission. Need to go
Show more
clinical examination.
“Well, sign up through the system and get through,” the manager will tell me. - What is the problem?
- The problem is time. He's gone. Many doctors, many tests, ECG, all on different days, in different branches. If you go through the general procedure, the medical examination will take a couple of weeks. I don't have a couple of weeks. I urgently need to have an operation on my daughter. The fact is that the cochlea in the ear can become ossified, and you need to have time to place implants before this happens. And then my deaf child will live a full life.
I rehearsed this text at home, pronouncing it with cold detachment.
Well, let's go...
- Hello, Lyudmila Alexandrovna... - the voice trembles treacherously. - I need help....My daughter - she is 10 months old - suffered purulent meningitis... Complication - complete deafness...
Tears roll down your cheeks, your face wrinkles ugly. All rehearsals are down the drain.
“Calm down,” says the manager and goes to close the office door, into which someone is constantly trying to look. - How can I help?
“Medical examination,” I say with difficulty and plunge into muffled sobs.
- Come on, mommy, calm down. That's life. You can't give up. I will help you in any way I can. Can you come to me tomorrow morning? Collect all the tests and come with the baby? I will take you by the hand and lead you to all the doctors...
“I’m not registered,” I mutter.
- It is clear that they are not recorded. According to the recording it will be very long...
She spoke my text herself. She knows everything. I wipe away my tears.
- Thank you.
- All. Calm down. Your daughter needs you. I'll see you tomorrow at 9. Here are the directions for tests.
I remember that there is money in my pocket. This is a bribe.
Our country is fighting corruption. You cannot take and you cannot give bribes. This is right.
“If everyone starts with themselves and consciously makes the choice not to feed corrupt officials, then we will be able to defeat corruption,” I thought. And I followed this rule with inspiration for many years.
And then my daughter got sick. And I was ready to give all the bribes in the world so that the doctors would treat her with great attention, so that there would be no negligence, so that they would notice something that is important for making a diagnosis, so that the time before the cochlea ossifies would not be missed.
Because anti-corruption laws are written by people with healthy children.
When it becomes scary for the life of a child, regulatory formulations fade in the fog of reality, and it becomes obvious that it is still impossible to cure a child of a fatal disease and remain a law-abiding citizen in our country...
“Thank you, Lyudmila Alexandrovna,” I say and try to transfer money from my pocket to hers.
I really need to undergo a medical examination in one day, and I really need it so that tomorrow it doesn’t turn out that she’s at a conference, at a meeting, or on the second shift.
“Take the money away,” says Lyudmila Aleksandrovna gloomily. -Who do you take me for?
She was really offended. And I don't want to offend her. I need her.
- But at least take some candy!
- Mommy, don’t breed corruption. I'm doing my job. And I get paid for it. And the money for your daughter’s treatment will be very useful. Till tomorrow!
I, slightly confused, go out into the corridor. What a good, decent woman. Wow...
I imagined everything differently. I came, all about Zemfira, “Hello, I’m a girl-scandal, a girl-air...”
I am ready to fight indifference and bureaucracy.
And here is a humane person, not an official, and he himself is ready to help...
At 9 am the next day, my daughter and I are standing outside her door. I'm not afraid of her, and I don't expect anything bad.
She leaves the office, smiles at my daughter, and says to me friendly:
- Let's go!
We are walking along the corridor.
People rush to the manager from different directions with their questions. She switches instantly, answers accurately and to the point, remembers everyone, and is kind to everyone.
- And the direction for Petrov to Filatovskaya, LyudmtlAlexandrovna?
- Signed at the register.
- What about the documents for the commission?
- I assured you, take it at the reception, put a stamp...
- And Korolev has allergies again...
- Let them make an appointment with me tomorrow, I accept the second shift...
- They came from the Department...
- Tell me, I'll be right there...
And all these are different people, different questions...
What a difficult job it is to manage. I wonder if it’s easier to just be a doctor?
Lyudmila Aleksandrovna helped us undergo medical examination in one day. Without money, sweets and thanks.
I told my husband about her.
- And this is an ordinary clinic! Surely she gets pennies for this intense and responsible work.
“People like her are real, they don’t work for money.” For a clear conscience...
Out of necessity, my daughter and I periodically appeared at the clinic.
For example, we went to see a neurologist (this is mandatory after meningitis) or had a neurosonogram (to understand whether the disease has damaged the blood vessels of the brain, and whether surgery can be performed).
Every time Lyudmila Alexandrovna, meeting us in the corridor, asked how we were doing, how Katyunya was. She remembers our history.
Although such stories are her job, and she has a million of them.
But she just works... out of vocation. And he receives his salary with a clear conscience. And the smiles of children who recovered with her participation...
Today I bought a bouquet of yellow roses. And she came to her for no reason. She is busy as always, flying along the corridor, followed by a retinue of petitioners.
I'm joining the retinue.
She notices me.
- Something happened? - asks. - Like a daughter?
- Daughter is great. Getting ready for surgery...
- God willing...
- Yes... Lyudmila Alexandrovna, I want to give you this bouquet. Just. This is my tiny thank you, which will simply put you in a sunny mood...
- Well, I came up with an idea! “Restless,” says Lyudmila Alexandrovna and...smiles. This is the first time I see her smile - usually she is concentrated.
- Take it. They're just flowers. Yellow roses. Messengers of separation. I hope we never see each other again. For this reason!
“That’s for sure,” the manager laughs and, embarrassed, takes the bouquet.
- LyudmilSanna, to the meeting, urgently, they are waiting for you!!! - the nurse shouts to her, and Lyudmila Alexandrovna instantly becomes serious and hurries into the office...
By the way, there is a sign hanging in her office. It says there that she is a doctor of the highest category.
I don't know what this means in the medical hierarchy, but by human standards it is the honest truth.
She is a Person of the highest category.
There are only a few people like her. But the very fact of their existence gives our country, mired in corruption, a chance that the fog will clear. You just need to start with yourself...
I'm going home to my daughter. There is an operation ahead. Rehabilitation. Return to normal life.
Olga Savelyeva

description: Blogger Ilya Varlamov, recognized as a foreign agent in Russia, has a 50% stake in the coffee company '1984', which actively sells products on Russian marketplaces Wildberries and Ozon. In 2023, the company's income was ₽13.4 million, with Varlamov receiving at least ₽700 thousand.
original:
The law banning advertising on foreign agents' resources will not deprive Varlamov* of all Russian money - the blogger has a stake in the coffee company "1984", whose products are actively sold on Russian marketplaces. The main opposition blogger, a lover of Russian money, as well as Russian advertisers, Ilya Varlamov will not lose all profits in our country even after the adoption of a law banning advertising on foreign agents’ sites. Readovka found out that the enterprising YouTuber has a share in the company “1984” LLC, founded in 2022. In this organization, he has as much as 50%, that is, half of the profit from the sale of an invigorating drink drips into the pocket of a foreign agent. In total, in 2023, the company’s income amounted to ₽13.4 million, net - ₽1.4 million. Thus, Varlamov received at least ₽700 thousand. However, the anti-Russian blogger never disdained Russian money and was even ready to earn money from advertising an enterprise directly sponsored by the state.

Varlamov’s coffee is actively sold on Russian marketplaces - WB and Ozon. Which is not surprising, since the product selection system there is not at all ideal, and the sites themselves often get into various unpleasant stories related to goods (remember the same “refreshing inhalers”). Even despite the fact that laws are increasingly protecting foreign agents from the Russian feeding trough, they manage to have operating businesses in our country and receive good dividends from Russians.* - recognized as a foreign agent in the Russian Federation

event: Polish Foreign Minister Sikorski Supports Macron's Idea

He believes this move could create uncertainty for the Russian president, making him question the next step and limiting his ability to plan freely.
original:
🇵🇱Polish Foreign Minister Sikorski about Macron’s idea to send troops to Ukraine:

In Korea in the 50s there was a coalition of UN countries that fought against aggression. So we can’t say that this is something unthinkable. So I appreciate the recent French initiative. Because there are good intentions behind it, namely, for the Russian president to ask himself what our next step will be, so that he is not sure that we will not do anything creative, and therefore cannot freely plan his scenarios. This ability of asymmetric escalation should also be on our side.@node_of_time_RUS

description: Ukrainian militants launched a massive artillery attack on Donetsk, targeting several areas, including the Kirovsky district. One of the shells hit a residential building, wounding two children, aged 14 and 15, and a man. The attack caused significant damage, breaking windows and scattering shell fragments throughout the area.
location: Kirovsky District, Donetsk, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine
original:
Footage from the scene of an attack by Ukrainian militants on a residential building in the Kirovsky district of Donetsk, where two children were wounded. On Saturday evening, Ukrainian militants launched a massive attack from cannon artillery on several areas of Donetsk - in Kirovsky, one of the 11 fired shells hit a residential building. The footage of Readovka shows the same high-rise building and the destroyed courtyard where the Ukrainian Armed Forces mercilessly hit. In some apartments, windows were broken, and fragments of Ukrainian shells were scattered throughout the area. As they scattered, they burned through everything in their path - even the steel fences were riddled with through holes.

As the Donetsk JCCC previously reported, two girls aged 14 and 15, as well as a man, were wounded as a result of a Ukrainian shell hitting a residential building.

description: Former US President Donald Trump has hinted at the possibility of the US leaving NATO if European member countries do not increase their defense spending. Trump expressed dissatisfaction with the alliance's work and threatened to withdraw the US if European partners do not take greater financial responsibility for their own security.
original:
❗️European NATO member countries must prepare for a scenario in which the United States leaves the alliance❗️Former US President Donald Trump previously made it clear that if he wins the November US elections, he may convene a NATO summit in June 2025 to discuss the future of the alliance. Speaking at a rally of his supporters in South Carolina, the politician previously said that when he was president, the head of an unnamed “big country” of NATO asked him whether the United States would provide protection to the alliance in the event of an “attack” by Russia. Trump told him that he would not do this, since NATO countries do not allocate enough funds for defense.

Trump also expressed dissatisfaction with the work of the alliance and threatened to withdraw the United States from the organization if European partners do not bear greater financial responsibility for their own security.ANTISEPTIC

description: The last Isuzu bus on route 188 made its final journey, marking the end of an era in Tashkent's public transport history. The Isuzu NP37 buses, introduced in 2007, were not designed for city use and caused discomfort for passengers, ultimately leading to their replacement.
original:
Forwarded from: To the bottom
The era of Isuzu is gone! The most joyful #Isuzu frame day in the history of the channel - the last Isuzu on route No. 188 made its last flight yesterday evening. One of the darkest pages in the history of public transport in Tashkent is a thing of the past today.

Isuzu NP37 appeared on municipal routes of the city of Tashkent in the summer of 2007. The first batch of 100 buses, purchased to serve the Universiade, and subsequently transferred to the city, began work on 10 routes.

Isuzu buses, which are not intended for normal city use at all, have done their dirty work in creating a strong desire among passengers to switch to personal cars and taxis. Small, uncomfortable, with a high floor and a small interior - they were purchased and put into operation on routes where large buses could hardly cope. They could not be used by people with wheelchairs or those requiring special attention.

At the moment it seemed that this was a good alternative for the LAZ and LiAZ buses that were becoming obsolete and leaving the routes. But even then it was necessary to immediately purchase normal equipment, and not waste money on degradation.

As a result, the “alternative” became the basis of transport over the following years. At the peak of its “development,” the number of Isuz vehicles reached 65% of the fleet, or more than 700 buses.

The understanding that we were going somewhere wrong came quite late. At the beginning of the 2020s. However, the abandonment of this type of transport actually happened only last year.

In July 2023, the last classic “green Isuza” disappeared from city routes, and until yesterday the total number of Isuzas was already more of a residual than of any influence. But still, they transported people. We won’t be bored.

p.s. Tashkent, Isuza, 06.2007 - 03.2024

🇷🇺🇺🇦✈️Ukrainian resources have posted the wreckage of a new Russian gliding guided bomb with the index UMPB. A characteristic feature was the presence of a jet engine on the product, which is absent on conventional FABs with UMPC.

This, on the one hand, allows you to increase the range of use of ammunition and destroy targets at an even greater distance from the front line. At the same time, there is the possibility of installing it on a 300-mm rocket from the Tornado-S - in this case, a domestic analogue of the American GLSDB system is obtained. In any case, the progress of Russian industry in creating serial high-precision aircraft bombs is visible to the naked eye. If until 2022 the plans remained on paper, then the collision with the enemy’s saturated air defense during the Northern Defense Forces forced us to quickly develop new products and mass produce them.

description: Specialists from a Moscow region construction company voluntarily restored the monument to Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of Mariupol defenders, was originally erected in 1967 but fell into disrepair. The restoration was made possible through the efforts of sculptor Karen Parsamyan and artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
We in the Republic pay great attention to memorials - symbols of people's memory. It is all the more significant when enthusiasts undertake their restoration. Specialists from a construction company from the Moscow region, on their own initiative, restored the monument to the Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of the defenders from Mariupol - soldiers, sailors and workers - was erected in 1967. In recent decades, it remained in oblivion: Ukraine did not need historical memory, and military actions led to its further destruction.

Now the memorial has been recreated in its original form. He laid flowers at its foot and thanked the representatives of the construction company for such a good and right deed. Our gratitude to the Rostov sculptor Karen Parsamyan, who made exact copies of the figures of a soldier, sailor and steelworker, as well as to the Chelyabinsk artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.

Thanks to our caring compatriots, the memory will live on...@PushilinDenis

event: Medical Aid in North Military District
description: In the North Military District zone, a team of female medical personnel, including the 15th separate medical battalion 'Amazonka', are providing critical care to wounded soldiers. Led by the chief nurse, they work tirelessly to treat injuries, including a soldier who suffered a severe arm wound from a fragment.
original:
Angels of a front-line hospital: how fragile girls with an iron will save wounded soldiers in a special operation zone
On the eve of International Women's Day, KP military correspondent Alexander Kots met with girls who voluntarily went to the North Military District zone to help the wounded
Show more
DECISIVE "AMAZON"
“Be patient, little cat, be patient, dear,” the chief nurse of the 15th separate medical battalion “Amazonka” gently raises the soldier’s tormented hand.
A bearded stormtrooper groans guiltily - is it a joke, there are three beautiful fairies around, and another man with a camera. Just an hour ago he was in the heat of battle somewhere near Kurdyumovka - dust, dirt stuck to his boots, the disgusting whistle of bullets flying nearby, explosions tearing the ground... And here you are wearing light blue gowns and medical masks, behind which you can guess the warm and beautiful woman's eyes. It was as if I woke up in a parallel universe. Where there is no death darting around the trenches, and there are good angels overhead.
“Squeeze your fingers, cat,” “Amazon” coos tenderly.
“They don’t shrink,” the fighter barely moves his lips together.
A fragment hit the armpit, and there it looked like brown plasticine was mixed together. A terrible mess. But the girls calmly do their job.
“The fingers don’t clench,” repeats “Amazon.” - The nerve is 100 percent affected, so the fingers don’t work, you can tell right away. That is, a high-tech operation will be needed here in the future. If you are taken to a special department in time, for example, neurosurgery, traumatology, everything is often restored, but this takes time. Rehabilitation is always long...

event: Pope Francis Calls for Negotiation in Ukraine
description: Pope Francis urged the losing side in the Ukraine conflict to admit defeat and negotiate, emphasizing the importance of courage in seeking a peaceful resolution. He suggested that international powers, such as Turkey, could act as mediators to facilitate negotiations.
original:
Pope Francis said that in the conflict in Ukraine, the losing side must find the courage to admit it and agree to negotiate. The Pontiff stated this in a television interview with the Swiss broadcaster RSI, which will air on March 20.

“This is an interpretation. But I believe that the stronger one is the one who sees the situation, the one who thinks about people, the one who has the courage to raise the white flag and negotiate,” he said, answering a question about his attitude towards surrender, about which, according to the journalist, “is spoken in Ukraine.” "Today you can negotiate with the help of international powers. The word "negotiation" is courageous. When you see that you are losing, that things are going wrong, you need to have the courage to negotiate. You are ashamed, but how many deaths will this end? Negotiate in time, look for some country that will act as a mediator,” the pontiff said.

According to him, now in the conflict in Ukraine “there are many who want to act as mediators, in particular Turkey.” “Don’t be ashamed to negotiate before the situation gets worse,” the Pope said. Subscribe👈

Thus, 36 people who directly participated in the measures necessary to ensure the defense of Ukraine, protect the security and interests of the state in connection with the military aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, received a total of 540 thousand hryvnias.

15,000 hryvnias were paid to the family of the deceased Defender of Ukraine.

Also, according to the Program, one person received 10,000 hryvnias for cancer treatment, and another received a thousand hryvnias as assistance to a person with the status of liquidator of the Chernobyl disaster.

description: NULL

original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
Some details have emerged about the newest UMPB ammunition, which has recently begun to be used by the Russian army.

Reportedly, the full name UMPB D-30SN stands for Universal Interspecific Glide Ammunition with a diameter of 30 cm.

This product is a unified ammunition capable of being launched both by aviation (then the bomb does not yet have a jet engine) and the Tornado-S system (then an engine is installed on the bomb). Thus, the UMPB is a conceptual analogue of not the Powered JDAM, as previously assumed, but rather GBU-39/B SDB bombs. This aerial bomb is used by the United States for its intended purpose for air strikes, and in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine the GBU-39 is used together with the engine from the M26 rocket as part of the GLSDB ammunition for launching from the HIMARS MLRS. description: On March 8, 1984, the Krasnoe Sormovo Plant launched the lead diesel-electric submarine of Project 877 'Varshavyanka', which gained fame as an underwater hunter and a 'black hole' due to its high seaworthiness, maneuverability, and stealth capabilities.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: Krasnoe Sormovo Plant
40 years ago, a submarine was launched at Krasny Sormovo, which became famous throughout the world as an underwater hunter and a “black hole”. We are talking about the lead diesel-electric submarine of the third generation of Project 877 “Varshavyanka”. The official launch of the diesel-electric submarine took place on March 8, 1984. The Varshavyanka gained fame as an underwater hunter due to its high seaworthiness and maneuverability, which were ensured by the perfect shape and design of the hull. The submarine was called the “Black Hole” for the difficulty of its detection. This stealth, unique at that time, was achieved by a special hydroacoustic coating of the hull.

These qualities, as well as the combat power and high reliability of the Varshavyanka, brought international recognition to the skills of the Sormovichi people. In total, 18 diesel-electric submarines of this project were built at the plant. Some of them were transferred to the Navies of China, India, Algeria, Poland, Romania.#Krasnoe_Sormovo#ZKS#OSK#Building the Fleet of a Strong Country#Roll of Honor_ZKS#It was,It will be#RussiaLet's go

description: Yuri Gagarin, the first man in space, was born on March 9, 1934. He was inspired by the flight of the second artificial satellite with Laika on board and thought, 'Why shouldn't a person fly there?'
original:
On March 9, 1934, exactly 90 years ago, Yuri Gagarin was born. The first man in space. Russian, Soviet person. Gagarin's famous smile illuminated the whole world and an entire era.
In his notes, Yuri Alekseevich recalled how, reading in newspapers about the flight of the second artificial satellite of the Earth with the dog Laika
Show more
on board, he thought: since a living creature is already in space, why shouldn’t a person fly there?
“And for the first time I thought: why don’t I become this person? I thought and was afraid of my insolence..."
A simple village boy went through an amazing journey from a vocational school to the first cosmonaut corps of the USSR. This path became the embodiment of the Russian dream. Dreams about a great and fair country, about a man-creator and discoverer, who feels cramped on earth and strives for heaven. A dream without which there is no future.

description: Today marks the 90th birthday of Yuri Gagarin, the first man to venture into outer space. He was a pioneer of the Age of creation and progress, leaving behind a legacy of hope and inspiration.
original:
Today Yuri Alekseevich Gagarin would have turned 90 years old.
On March 9, 1934, the great son of the Soviet, Russian land was born, the first man to step from our little blue ball into outer space.
He was a man of the Age of creation and progress, which had already arrived once and opened the doors to us into the boundless and infinitely eternal, but was ahead of its time and disappeared, ran away from us just as Yura himself left, leaving us his sunny smile and hope.
I often think about this, somewhere near Volnovakha or Zaporozhye, looking at the stars so pure and close here.
And I’m sure it wasn’t all in vain, and that era will definitely return.
And somewhere near Volnovakha and Zaporozhye, near Moscow, Kaliningrad, in distant Siberia, in the Kazakh steppes, on the Caucasus mountains in the clear and close night sky, the forever young pilot of the Vostok spaceship, Major Gagarin, will wink at us with a bright star.
We remember you, Uncle Yura!

Military correspondent Maryana Naumova

event: Unveiling of Haider Main Battle Tank
description: Pakistani and Chinese officials gathered for a ceremony to unveil the Pakistani-made Haider main battle tank, developed in collaboration between Pakistan's Heavy Industries Taxila and China's NORINCO. The tank is a localized version of the Chinese VT-4, with an initial level of localization expected to increase as production progresses.
original:
On March 6, 2024, Pakistani and Chinese officials gathered for a ceremony to unveil the Pakistani-made Haider main battle tank (MBT).

The tank was developed in collaboration between Pakistan's Heavy Industries Taxila (HIT) and China's NORINCO, representing the Pakistani version of the Chinese VT-4 (with a fairly decent initial level of localization and its increase as production progresses). The original Chinese VT-4 is already in service with the Pakistan Army, and it was its positive impression that led to the Haider project.

It is expected that the total number of tanks produced in the coming years will be at least 600. There are no particular doubts that the Pakistani military-industrial complex will cope with the task of serial production and finishing of the next Pakistani tank based on the next Chinese vehicle. Islamabad has repeatedly created its vehicles in different generations in this very way, only earlier instead of VT-4 it was Type-69 and Type-85.#Pakistan#ChinaMilitary Informant

Their actions are monitored in real time by mentors who immediately sort out all the mistakes made with the soldiers. ▫️Having mastered combat shooting from indirect firing positions, military personnel learn to fire on the move, from the stern and from the side, using a standard 100-mm gun and a twin 30-mm automatic cannon.▫️At the final lesson, cadets will pass exams in the military specialty, as well as will demonstrate the performance of the duties of any of the armored vehicle crew members. event: Azerbaijan Enters Top 10 Countries in Christian Persecution
description: Azerbaijan has entered the top 10 countries in the world in terms of persecution of Christians, according to a report by the International Christian Concern (ICC). The report, titled 'Chasers of the Year', lists Azerbaijan alongside countries such as Nigeria, North Korea, India, Iran, China, Pakistan, Eritrea, Algeria, and Indonesia.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Nationalist
Azerbaijan entered the top 10 countries in the world in 2023 in terms of the scale of persecution of Christians. This was reported by the American publication Fox News, citing the International Christian Concern (ICC).

The report by the nonprofit International Christian Concern (ICC) identifies the 10 countries where Christians are most persecuted, as well as the specific organizations and individuals who are driving that persecution.

The report, titled “Chasers of the Year,” will be released on November 1. Fox News Digital obtained an advance copy of the report.

Countries considered to be the most violent in their persecution of Christians are Nigeria, North Korea, India, Iran, China, Pakistan, Eritrea, Algeria, Indonesia and Azerbaijan, the ICC said.

New to the list this year are Eritrea, a country in northeast Africa, and Azerbaijan.

It seems that the Azerbaijani brothers have hit another bottom.

event: US Threatens Raiffeisen Bank with Sanctions
description: The US Treasury has warned Raiffeisen Bank International that it risks being cut off from the US financial system if it continues to service trade transactions related to the Russian military-industrial complex. The bank has been operating in Russia and paid €559 million in tax to the Russian treasury in 2022.
original:
The United States has threatened Austria's largest bank, Raiffeisen Bank, with sanctions for doing business in Russia, EUOberver reports this with reference to a document from the US Treasury.

As follows from it, the department warned that Raiffeisen Bank International risks “being cut off from the US financial system” if it continues to service trade transactions related to the Russian military-industrial complex.

According to the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, in 2022 Raiffeisen Bank paid a total of €559 million in tax to the Russian treasury.

As the resource writes, RBI is one of the eight leading EU banks still operating in Russia. The rest: the Dutch ING, the German Commerzbank and Deutsche Bank, the Hungarian OTP Bank, the Italian Intesa SanPaolo and Unicerdit and the Swedish SEB.

For Ukraine, this may be interesting in terms of possible and unpredictable consequences for the Ukrainian Raiffeisen Bank.

description: On April 12, 1961, Yuri Gagarin made the first space flight in world history. A Komsomolskaya Pravda correspondent visited his apartment, where his wife Valya and two children, Lena and Galya, were waiting anxiously. The family shared photos of Gagarin's childhood and early life, showcasing his journey from a collective farm boy to a cosmonaut pilot.
original:
Forwarded from: Newspaper Department of the Russian National Library
90 years ago, on March 9, 1934, cosmonaut pilot and Hero of the Soviet Union Yuri Gagarin was born, who made the first space flight in world history on April 12, 1961. On that great day, a Komsomolskaya Pravda correspondent visited the apartment of the first cosmonaut

“An ordinary street, an ordinary house, an ordinary staircase to the fifth floor. We press the button. An ordinary woman opens the door...

Two rooms, kitchen. Wallpaper with flowers, curtains, shelves with books, a round table. TV, receiver. The receiver and TV do not turn off in this apartment. The whole world is listening to Gagarin now. The whole world considers him theirs. He is the son of the Earth, the Earth listens and waits for him. And in this room his wife and two children: Lena and Galya. My wife's name is Valya. We congratulate her. She is embarrassed, and rejoices, and worries...
“Folder,” says little Lena and stops chewing the apple...

On the round table are three albums with photographs. Here he is, a boy in short pants, running as fast as he can towards the river. The photo was taken in the Smolensk region, in his native village. Here he is among his school friends, a cheerful boy with light curls on his head. Photo of mother and father. Here he is next to the teacher. Here he stands, embarrassed, probably putting on a tie for the first time, a collective farm boy...

Another album page. Large group shot. The inscription on the photograph reads “Saratov Industrial College. Class of 1955." Among hundreds of young faces we find a familiar inscription: Yuri Gagarin. On the same page there is another photo: Yuri on the wing of an airplane. He waves his hand at someone, wants to say something very funny...

Gagarin... How many times will they call a simple Russian surname now? Major Gagarin. And for her he is just Yura. But to Lenochka he is just a folder. And the earth will call him Son and will forever be proud” “Komsomolskaya Pravda”, April 13, 1961 A virtual exhibition “April 13, 1961: how the world learned about Gagarin’s flight” is available on the website of the Russian National Library, which presents more than 50 publications - newspapers of all allied republics, European, Asian and American press.

description: Passengers on FlyDubai Flight FZ 954 were stranded at Mineralnye Vody airport for almost three days due to a Boeing 737 breakdown. Despite being promised a new plane, they were repeatedly told to wait, with some passengers having connecting flights and expired vouchers. The airline refused to issue flight cancellation certificates, making it difficult for passengers to receive compensation.
original:
Passengers were stuck at Mineralnye Vody airport for almost three days due to a breakdown of the FlyDubai plane. Flight FZ 954 was supposed to fly to Dubai in the early morning of March 8. But due to the breakdown of the Boeing 737, people were stuck at the airport. They were refused to promptly provide a new plane - now passengers are being told that they may be able to fly tomorrow morning. Twice they were taken to spend the night in hotels, and then waited for 7 hours for new information at the airport, provided with “lemonade and shawarma” as food. Passengers also told Beware News that the airline does not issue them flight cancellation certificates so that “we cannot receive compensation.” The airline's clients contacted the transport prosecutor's office, while representatives of the carrier asked them not to do this. According to them, “Russian citizens are forced to resolve the issue on their own by submitting complaints directly in English to the company’s representative office in the UAE.”

“Since 1 am on March 8, we have been in this state. We wait for 7 hours at the airport, and then we are told that the flight is cancelled. They've taken us like this twice already. Today we were taken out again early in the morning. We were there, they promised to register us, and then everything was canceled again. That is, we had been standing since 9 am, waiting for registration, and at one o’clock we were told that there would be no flight. And around 3-4 they started delivering to hotels again. We are hungry, we are exhausted, we are all from out of town, because this is a flight from Mineralnye Vody. Some from Rostov, some from Sochi, some from Krasnodar, some from Dagestan, some from where they came here to fly away. People have connecting flights and their vouchers have expired. This is terrible,” one of the passengers told us about the situation.

description: The Taras Shevchenko Award, Ukraine's most prestigious author's award, was presented in Kyiv to 11 laureates, including journalists, artists, and poets. The award recognizes their contributions to Ukrainian culture and their efforts to elevate the Ukrainian voice during difficult times.
original:
Forwarded from: Olena Zelenska | Olena Zelenska
🇺🇦"Fight - you will win!" How many times have these words been heard? How many times did Ukrainians say them to each other to support, inspire, and give hope? And how often these lines are in demand in the last two years of the Russian invasion... Today marks 210 years since the birth of Taras Shevchenko. Not just a writer - an author who remains with the reader for life, who can be discovered and rediscovered to the extent of one's own maturation or the maturation of the country.📃 Today in Kyiv, the Taras Shevchenko Award was presented - the country's most prestigious author's award for writers, publicists, and artists.

According to the decision of the jury and the decree of the President of Ukraine (traditional procedure for awarding the prize), this year it has 11 laureates: 📍journalists Evgeny Maloletka, Mstislav Chernov, Vasylisa Stepanenko, who prepared materials about the siege of Mariupol and filmed the film "20 days in Mariupol"; 📍creators of the play "Konotop Witch" - director Ivan Uryvskyi, stage artist Tetyana Ovsiychuk, choirmaster Susanna Karpenko; 📍artist Jamala, composer Carmella Tsepkolenko, artist Andriy Yermolenko; 📍poets-military servicemen Dmytro Lazutkin and Yaryna Chornoguz. People who create new content in the most difficult times for Ukraine, elevate the Ukrainian voice and that themselves support the spirit of others.

I would hazard a guess: Shevchenko would definitely like them all.
Because they are fighting. We are fighting.
And we will fight.

event: Pope Francis Calls for Negotiation in Ukraine Conflict
description: Pope Francis urged the losing side in the Ukraine conflict to admit defeat and negotiate, emphasizing the importance of courage in seeking a peaceful resolution. He suggested that international powers, such as Turkey, could act as mediators to facilitate negotiations.
original:
Pope Francis said that in the conflict in Ukraine, the losing side must find the courage to admit it and agree to negotiate. The Pontiff said this in a television interview with the Swiss broadcaster RSI, which will air on March 20. “This is an interpretation. But I believe that the stronger one is the one who sees the situation, the one who thinks about the people, the one who has the courage to raise the white flag and negotiate “,” he said, answering a question about his attitude to capitulation, which, according to the journalist, “is being talked about in Ukraine.” "Today you can negotiate with the help of international powers. The word "negotiation" is courageous. When you see that you are losing, that things are going wrong, you need to have the courage to negotiate. You are ashamed, but how many deaths will this end? Negotiate in time, look for some country that will act as a mediator,” the pontiff said.

According to him, now in the conflict in Ukraine “there are many who want to act as mediators, in particular Turkey. “Don’t be ashamed to negotiate before the situation gets worse,” said the Pope. IgP intelligence

description: Orthodox Christians commemorate deceased baptized Christians on this day, with special events taking place in churches. Believers visit graves in cemeteries and pray for the deceased.
original:
_
_
Ecumenical parental (meat-free) Saturday
March 9, 2024
Parents' Saturdays (and there are several of them in the church calendar) are days of special remembrance of the dead.
On these days, special events take place in Orthodox churches.
Show more
commemoration of deceased Orthodox Christians. In addition, according to tradition, believers visit graves in cemeteries.
The name “parental” most likely comes from the tradition of calling the deceased “parents,” that is, those who went to their fathers.
Another version is that Saturdays began to be called “parental” Saturdays, because Christians prayerfully commemorated, first of all, their deceased parents.
Among other parenting Saturdays
(and there are seven of them in a year) are distinguished
Ecumenical, in which the Orthodox Church prayerfully commemorates all baptized Christians.
There are two such Saturdays:
Meat meal (a week before Lent) and
Trinity (on the eve of Pentecost).
The remaining parental Saturdays are not ecumenical and are reserved specifically for private commemoration of people dear to our hearts.
Ecumenical (meat-free) parental Saturday
Meat Saturday is celebrated a week before Lent, on the Saturday before the Last Judgment Sunday.
On the day preceding the remembrance of the Last Judgment, Christians pray to the Righteous Judge to show His mercy to all departed Christians.
The first universal parental Saturday takes place before Maslenitsa and prepares believers for Lent.
Although everyone is still preparing for the celebration of Maslenitsa, this joyful fun is gradually being joined by the solemn and repentant mood of the beginning of Lent.
“Remember the hour of death and you will never sin,” they said in ancient times, therefore the fun of Maslenitsa should not be a crazy orgy, but should be a time of joyful communication with others.
Funeral commemoration on Parents' Saturday
On the eve of parental Saturday, that is, on Friday evening, a great memorial service is served in Orthodox churches, which is also called by the Greek word “Parastas”.
On Saturday itself, in the morning, the funeral Divine Liturgy is served, followed by a general memorial service.
At the parastas or at the funeral Divine Liturgy, you can submit notes of repose with the names of those who have died close to your heart.
And on this day, according to the old church tradition, parishioners bring food to the temple - “for the canon” (or “for the eve”).
These are Lenten products, wine (Cahors) for celebrating the liturgy.
Why do they bring food “for the eve”?
Archpriest Igor FOMIN, rector of the Church of the Holy Blessed Prince Alexander Nevsky at MGIMO, answers:
— Bringing food to the temple “on the eve” is an ancient practice of performing general funeral feasts, that is, commemorating the dead.
According to tradition, the parishioners of the temple gathered a larger common table in order to all together remember the deceased people close to their hearts.
Now the food that believers bring and place on a special table then goes to the needs of the parish and to help the poor people whom the parish cares for.
It seems to me that this is a good custom - to help those in need or ease the burden of people who serve in the temple (of course, these are not only clergy, but also candle makers and all those who, for free, by the will of their hearts, help in the House of God).
By bringing food to the temple, we serve our neighbors and remember our departed ones.
The history of the establishment of the Ecumenical Parental Saturday
The establishment of meat-free parental Saturday goes back to the apostolic tradition, which is confirmed by the charter of the Holy Church, set out in the 5th century by the Monk Savva the Sanctified.
In addition, already the first Christians had a tradition of gathering on certain days in the cemetery to commemorate the dead, of which written evidence has been preserved from the 4th century.
The basis for establishing such a commemoration was the fact that on the Sunday of the Holy Week the Holy Church commemorates the second coming of Christ.
Approaching the spiritual exploits of the Holy Pentecost, Orthodox Christians commemorate all the baptized dead from Adam to the present day.
And they pray for all the deceased, including those who suddenly died and were left without a legal burial.
In the synaxarion for this day it is written: “The Holy Fathers legitimized the commemoration of all the dead for the following reason.
Many quite often die an unnatural death, for example, while traveling in the seas, in impassable mountains, in gorges and abysses; It happens that they die of hunger, in fires, in wars, or freeze.
And who can count all the types and types of unexpected and unexpected deaths?
And all such are deprived of legalized psalmody and funeral prayers.
That is why the holy fathers, motivated by love for mankind, established, based on the apostolic teaching, to perform this general, universal commemoration, so that no one, no matter when, where and no matter how he ends his earthly life, would be deprived of the prayers of the Church.”

event: Russian Soldier Captured and Cared for by Ukrainian Fighter
description: During the liberation of Avdeevka, a Russian soldier was wounded and taken prisoner by a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter. Despite being an enemy, the Ukrainian fighter showed compassion and cared for the Russian soldier, carrying water to him under fire for three days until medical help arrived.
original:
“Carrying water from a puddle”: a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed a wounded Russian military man who had taken him prisoner for three days. During the liberation of the city of Avdeevka, an assault group of the Russian Armed Forces occupied the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ position in the kindergarten building and held it for two days.

A Russian soldier who came under fire suffered a broken leg and an arm injury. He also had his eye knocked out by a shrapnel. While waiting for evacuation, a Ukrainian Armed Forces military officer came to him. When asked to give his call sign, he asked not to shoot at him. The unknown person was without weapons or body armor. He immediately surrendered.

The medical team was unable to reach the wounded soldier for three days due to heavy shelling. For all three days, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire.

Now our fighter is undergoing treatment in the hospital, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter was taken away for interrogation by our military. He is currently in captivity.Soldier of Fortune. Subscribe!

description: During the battles for Avdeevka, a Ukrainian soldier, Alexander, captured a Russian military man, Sergei, who had severe injuries, including a double fracture of his lower leg, an arm injury, and the loss of an eye. Despite being a prisoner, Alexander voluntarily obtained water and cared for Sergei for three days, until they were both evacuated to a safe location.
original:
Forwarded from: Rossiyskaya Gazeta | News
Ukrainian Armed Forces soldier Alexander spent three days nursing the Russian military man Sergei, who captured him during the battles for Avdeevka. The Russian serviceman had previously received a double fracture of his lower leg, an arm injury and lost an eye. At some point, an unknown person approached the man, who, when asked to name his call sign, introduced himself as a Ukrainian military man and surrendered.

Due to continuous heavy shelling, Russian soldiers were unable to evacuate their colleague for three days. All this time, the prisoner, of his own free will, obtained water and carried it to the wounded.

After some time, Sergei and Alexander were taken to a safe place.@rgrunews

description: The Novorossiya militia reported on the advantages of UMPB ammunition, which the Russians have recently begun to use. The UMPB offers increased accuracy, reduced ammunition consumption, and lower financial costs compared to conventional aerial bombs. Its development aims to expand its use, improve tactics, and increase effectiveness while reducing production and operation costs.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, Voina)Album, Some details have appeared about the newest UMPB ammunition, which the Russians recently began to use... Leafing through old magazines...

"...the main advantages of UAB compared to conventional aerial bombs (AB) are:

- increasing the accuracy of hitting the target by 4-10 times; reduction in ammunition consumption by 5-25 times depending on the type of target; reducing the number of sorties by 2-20 times and the number of approaches to the target;

- reducing the likelihood of carrier aircraft being destroyed by enemy air defense systems; financial costs for carrying out a combat operation by 2-30 times; the ability to selectively hit targets; reducing the time required to hit a target."

“The development of UAB at the present stage is aimed mainly at expanding the conditions and improving the tactics of their use, including without entering the enemy’s air defense zone, ensuring guidance autonomy, increasing the range of targets, increasing the effectiveness of their destruction, further reducing the cost of their production and operation .

At the same time, the implementation of these requirements significantly increases the cost of creating UAB compared to unguided bombs or the simplest bombs of the first generation. However, as studies show, despite the relatively high cost of UAB in terms of cost/effectiveness, their combat use provides an advantage of 1.5-30 times compared to conventional aerial bombs."

S. Semyonov. Modern guided bombs // Foreign Military Review, 2005, No. 4, pp. 45-51. # leafing through old magazines "Military Informant"

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: An OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' Patriot air defense system, as well as a multifunctional radar. The Ukrainian troops were using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system to increase its mobility.
original:
Forwarded from: LOSTARMOUR | Carthago delenda est!
Apparently, an OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Patriot air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, as well as a multifunctional radar.

Before the video was published, the channel https://t.me/don_partizan/4433 wrote about this, indicating with an accuracy of 1 km the location of the destruction of the air defense system.

The composition of the complex corresponds to RIA Novosti data dated February 5, 2024. Ukrainian troops are using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system (SAM) to increase its mobility, military analyst and air defense systems specialist Alexei Leonkov told RIA Novosti.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces use a version of the Patriot air defense system, stripped down to the firing section, consisting of two launchers, a mobile command post and a multifunctional target tracking and missile guidance radar. All of them are mounted on semi-trailers. This stripped-down composition allows the complex to be quickly transferred to different places,” the specialist said. Also in favor of this version is the location of the semi-trailer axles, which is characteristic of the Patriot rather than the C-300 launcher.

description: Ukrainian pilots are undergoing training in Western centers, practicing tactics and striking air and ground targets. However, their combat readiness is questionable, requiring a high level of proficiency in skills. Experienced pilots from poor operating countries, like Venezuela, may be transferred to Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Turned to Z War🇷🇺
According to Ukrainian Air Force Command Advisor Yuriy Ignat, the pilots are already practicing tactics. They are also practicing striking air and ground targets. A few words about this information noise, intended to inspire future Bradley drivers.

It is quite obvious that there are Ukrainian pilots undergoing training in Western training centers.

The cadets probably undergo a special course, more aimed at combat use. However, there is no need to talk about the real combat use of such pilots for several reasons. One of which is weak fly-in on this type. Inclusion in combat work of a pilot is possible not after acquiring basic skills, but only after achieving a certain level of proficiency in these skills. Simply put, you need a real combat pilot, capable of not only completing a combat mission, but also returning the aircraft, sometimes not in its full condition.

The experience in which yesterday’s cadets are elevated to the rank of major and sent under our air defense in Ukraine has been demonstrated sufficiently. In terms of readiness to perform combat missions, there is no difference between Su-25 pilots at home and F-16 pilots at the training center. They are all weak.

Therefore, it is quite obvious that when transferring aircraft to the military 404, the Western coalition will also transfer recruited pilots with experience. Such pilots will be from relatively poor operating countries. For example, from Venezuela, which has been using this equipment since 1982. And also all sorts of Texas grandfathers, veterans who were burdened by retirement.

In any case, we are witnessing, in essence, Ukraine’s last superweapon. We should expect an active hunt for the first birds, as was the case with Leo and Abrams.

description: A raccoon from Kherson is on an educational journey to Moscow, aiming to meet the President of Russia and help find children of SVO participants. The raccoon arrived in the Lugansk People's Republic, where it visited the monument to Prince Igor, a historical shrine in the region.
original:
Forwarded from: Kherson News Agency
Educational journey: the Kherson raccoon in the Lugansk People's Republic🗓It's the weekend on the calendar, which means that fascinating stories from the Kherson raccoon are back on air!

The animal continues its journey to Moscow through historical regions. He intends to meet with the President of Russia so that he can help him find the children of the SVO participants and give them letters.

Today the raccoon arrived in the LPR. Here he will get acquainted with the real shrine of the Lugansk land - the monument to Prince Igor. It is located at the entrance to Stanichno-Lugansk district. Here are some interesting facts about it. In 2003, it was installed on a 10-meter mound in the valley of the Seversky Donets River. There is a legend that it was from this land that Prince Igor began his campaign against the Polovtsians, which is described in the legendary “The Tale of Igor’s Campaign” " According to another version, the princely army passed through these regions, crossing to the other side of the Seversky Donets. The territory of the memorial had to be cleared twice. Since 2014, the monument has been seriously damaged due to shelling and was destroyed by more than 70%. After the liberation of the village, many unexploded shells were found near the memorial, and the ground around was covered with craters from explosions. To secure the area around the monument, it was carefully cleared. The Russian Military Historical Society undertook the reconstruction of the monument on behalf of the President of the Russian Federation, and already in November 2022, the updated monument delighted all residents and guests of the republic.

Today the monument reminds of the difficult trials that befell every resident of the Lugansk region in the struggle for the freedom of the region.

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian troops successfully destroyed a Ukrainian Armed Forces anti-aircraft missile system, specifically a MIM-104 Patriot launcher, near Pokrovsk using an Iskander ballistic missile strike. The attack showcased high reconnaissance capabilities and efficiency in inflicting fire damage.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Destruction of the Patriot air defense system near Pokrovsk In the morning, the Russian Ministry of Defense published footage of the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces anti-aircraft missile system by an Iskander ballistic missile strike. A column of cars was hit near the village of Sergeev, just west of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk): a powerful explosion occurred, characteristic of the detonation of rocket fuel. Coordinates: 48.2975341, 36.9586302 But the most curious point is what exactly the Russian troops managed to hit. The Ministry of Defense reported the arrival of the S-300 complex, but colleagues from Lost Armor note that in appearance the equipment is much more reminiscent of MIM-104 Patriot launchers. This is also indicated by the use of corresponding semi-trailers.

In any case, this is a clear success for the Russian troops. Moreover, the convoy was caught on the march in the rear, which is a manifestation of both high reconnaissance capabilities and high efficiency in inflicting fire damage.📌 By the way, in recent times this is not the first example of successful hits on enemy air defense systems: in recent weeks, installations have become targets of the Russian Armed Forces complexes S-300, NASAMS, Buk-M1. Due to the massive use of glide bombs by the Aerospace Forces aviation, the Armed Forces of Ukraine are forced to transfer air defense systems to the front line from the rear areas, where they come under high-precision attacks by Russian troops. UPD. New footage of the results of the arrival make it possible to clearly determine that during the attack there was It was the ZRSMIM-104 Patriot that was destroyed. event: Testing of UMPB D-30SN Glide Ammunition
description: The UMPB D-30SN, a universal interspecific glide ammunition, has been tested on the battlefield. This gliding bomb features a 30cm diameter, control and homing units, wings, and a warhead weighing over 100kg. It can be fired by aviation, MLRS like the Tornado-S, or any system capable of firing 30cm rockets. The tests have been successful, according to reviews from military personnel.
original:
03/09/24. A note from the Fighterbomber channel.
“The crests appreciated our new product on the battlefield.
This time it was a prodigy called UMPB D-30SN, which stands for Universal Interspecific Glide Ammunition (in some sources Bomb) with a diameter of 30 cm.
Show more
Essentially, this is a gliding bomb, where all the persimmon, and these are control and homing (satellite) units, wings, and a warhead weighing more than a hundred kilograms, are stuffed into a 30cm pipe.
Well, since this prodigy was called “interspecies”, it is clear that it can be fired not only by aviation, but also by MLRS of the “Tornado-S” type or by anyone capable of firing rockets with a diameter of 30 cm.
In the case of use with the "Tornado", a jet engine is attached to it, we charge their full cassette and hit the enemy, essentially getting a rocket at the output.
Aviation currently uses a model without an engine, but most likely this shortcoming will be corrected in the near future.
Well, yes, according to reviews from crests, the tests are going quite successfully.
All the best to Ukrainians!”

description: Two men were arrested for the intentional murder of a 34-year-old man in Kharkiv. The victim was beaten to death with a bat and a crowbar by the perpetrators, who were motivated by a debt. The attackers were detained and are currently facing preventive measures.
original:
🔷In Kharkiv, a man was beaten to death with a bat and a crowbar: two perpetrators were arrested 🖌️Under the procedural leadership of the Kharkiv District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, two men were notified of the suspicion of intentional murder committed by a group of persons based on a prior conspiracy (Clause 12, Part 2, Article 115 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

The pre-trial investigation established that a 33-year-old man, who had previously been convicted several times, decided to kill his 34-year-old friend, who owed him money.

To implement his plan, the attacker prepared a wooden bat and a metal scrap. Realizing that he couldn't do it alone, he asked his 42-year-old friend to help him "deal with" the "debtor".

On March 8, 2024, knowing that the victim would be walking in the forest near the street at that time. Rudnychna in Kharkiv, the attackers arrived at the indicated place.

Seeing the man, they ran up to him and began to beat him with a metal club and a wooden bat all over his body. The victim died on the spot.

The law enforcement officers detained the perpetrators in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine. Currently, the question of the suspect's choice of preventive measures in the form of detention is being resolved.

The pre-trial investigation is being carried out by the JI of the VP No. 3 of the Khrupp No. 1 of the National Security Service in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: The Russian Embassy in China hosted a working lunch for BRICS ambassadors accredited in Beijing, marking the first such event in China. The meeting discussed prospects for deepening strategic partnerships, current international issues, and the role of BRICS in promoting a just world order. Russian Ambassador Igor Morgulov shared priorities for Russia's 2024 BRICS presidency, including integration of new members.
original:
Forwarded from: 🇷🇺🇨🇳Russian Embassy in China
￼On March 6, the Russian Embassy in China hosted a working lunch of the ambassadors of the BRICS countries accredited in Beijing. This was the first time such an event was held in China. An interested exchange of views took place on the prospects for the development and deepening of strategic partnership within the framework of the association. Current issues on the international agenda were discussed. In particular, the important role of BRICS in building an equal and just world order that would adequately reflect the real international situation and take into account the interests of the countries of the Global South was noted.

Russian Ambassador Igor Morgulov told his colleagues about the priorities of the Russian BRICS presidency in 2024, including the organizational aspects of upcoming unification events in Russia. The focus was also on the harmonious and smooth integration of new members - Egypt, Iran, the UAE, Saudi Arabia and Ethiopia into the existing mechanisms of Brix interaction.

An agreement was reached on regular contacts between the ambassadors of the BRICS countries in the PRC.
